intro: Diphasiastrum complanatum var. dilatatum, commonly known as the broadleaf lichen or broadleaf moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and its ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments. The plant has a distinctive morphology with elongated, flat leaves that are often curled at the tips. It is typically found on soil surfaces, rocks, or decaying wood in temperate regions. This moss plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
